decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy Control - Stoneblade deck is to utilize powerful control elements such as Snapcaster Mage, Counterspell, and Force of Will to disrupt opponents, while also utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to apply pressure. The deck aims to control the game with permission spells like Spell Snare and Swords to Plowshares, and generate card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also incorporates some faerie synergy with Spellstutter Sprite and Vendilion Clique for additional disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Dismember and Diabolic Edict. Snapcaster Mage provides versatility by allowing the player to recast key instants and sorceries from the graveyard, and Tarmogoyf serves as a strong beatdown creature. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and additional control options to help close out the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Thoughtseize to take away key pieces from their hand. It also utilizes efficient creatures like Dark Confidant and Mirran Crusader to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. The inclusion of equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte enhances the effectiveness of the creatures. The deck also has a strong control element with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate to deal with threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland.

The primary focus of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan through the use of disruptive spells such as Force of Will, Stifle, and Hymn to Tourach. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Dismember, Go for the Throat, and Smother, while utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Tombstalker, and Snapcaster Mage to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to support this aggressive strategy with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while efficiently deploying threats that can quickly close out the game. With a combination of powerful creatures like Tombstalker and Vendilion Clique, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Counterspell, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage allow for flexibility and consistency in both card draw and reusing useful spells. Overall, the deck maintains a balance between aggressive plays and control elements to dominate the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck is focused on generating massive amounts of mana through various Elf creatures and utilizing it to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play quickly. It also includes ways to tutor for specific creatures or equipment cards, protect key creatures with Wirewood Symbiote, and pump up the entire Elf army with Mirror Entity or Ezuri, Renegade Leader. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its fast mana generation and explosive plays, ultimately securing victory with lethal creatures or equipment.

The main focus of this aggro Merfolk deck is to rapidly build a board presence of powerful Merfolk creatures, using cards like Coralhelm Commander, Lord of Atlantis, and Merrow Reejerey to overwhelm the opponent. Support is provided by counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as disruptive cards like Wasteland. Aether Vial helps accelerate the deployment of creatures onto the battlefield, while utility lands like Mutavault and Mishra's Factory provide additional versatility in combat. The deck aims to quickly assert control and pressure the opponent to victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disrupting opponents with control elements like counterspells and removal. It utilizes cards like Noble Hierarch and Knight of the Reliquary to ramp up and create threats, while also running disruption tools such as Brainstorm, Daze, and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also includes utility creatures like Aven Mindcensor and Gaddock Teeg, along with card advantage engines like Sylvan Library and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and includes efficient lands like Wasteland and Karakas.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana and play cards that build up to casting Goblin Charbelcher, which can then be used to win the game. It includes cards that generate mana fast, like rituals and mana-producing creatures, as well as cards that allow for card draw and alternative win conditions like Empty the Warrens through Burning Wish. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient in executing its game plan, aiming to win before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The key concept of this Legacy Aluren combo deck is to use Aluren to create a loop with various creatures that have enter the battlefield triggers, ultimately generating infinite value. The deck includes cards like Parasitic Strix, Cavern Harpy, Coiling Oracle, and Dream Stalker to continually bounce and replay creatures. It also includes cards like Imperial Recruiter, Eternal Witness, and Wall of Blossoms to search for and recycle key pieces. With efficient card draw and disruption through Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to assemble the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is composed of various fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the required colors.

The deck focuses on deploying a quick and aggressive strategy by utilizing powerful Merfolk creatures like Coralhelm Commander, Lord of Atlantis, and Merrow Reejerey. With disruptive elements like Cursecatcher and counterspells such as Daze and Force of Will, it aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm opponents. Aether Vial helps to quickly deploy creatures while Mutavault and Wasteland provide additional utility. The inclusion of Kira, Great Glass-Spinner offers protection against targeted removal spells, making the deck resilient against opposing strategies.

The main goal of this deck is to use powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary, Tarmogoyf, and Progenitus alongside disruptive spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Green Sun's Zenith, as well as card selection from Brainstorm and Vendilion Clique, the deck aims to establish early board presence and close out the game with efficient threats. Natural Order is a key card that can tutor for Progenitus or other big threats to rapidly end the game.

The deck aims to aggressively control the board using efficient creatures such as Tarmogoyf and powerful disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will. It utilizes a combination of card advantage through Dark Confidant and selection with cards like Brainstorm to keep up tempo and pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil adds additional value and versatility to the deck, allowing for both aggressive and controlling strategies. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while quickly clocking them with a midrange strategy.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It aims to control the board with cards like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach, while also presenting threats like Tarmogoyf and Vendilion Clique to close out the game quickly. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to generate card advantage and further disrupt the opponent's plans. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a variety of powerful spells and ensure consistency in gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts. By using cards like Etched Champion, Cranial Plating, and Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Ethersworn Canonist and Phyrexian Revoker provide additional disruption, while Thoughtcast and Stoneforge Mystic help maintain card advantage and tutor for key artifacts. With a focus on affinity for artifacts, this deck aims to quickly close out games through aggression and efficient card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using Faeries creatures along with powerful disruption spells like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize. The Faeries provide a steady stream of flying threats while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage from cards like Dark Confidant and Snapcaster Mage while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Dismember and Diabolic Edict. The manabase is focused on maximizing the efficiency of the spells while also providing utility with lands like Mutavault and Wasteland.
